node.title: Doctors were ready to let Tristan 'cark it' after a terrible accident. He just graduated from high school
node.alt: Tristan Sik wearing acamedic robes stands with a support worker and lifts his arm in celebration
node.description: A Queensland mother says she never imagined what her son would achieve when she ignored doctors' advice to turn off his life support four years ago.
node.content:
["Four years ago, Tristan Sik's mother was told repeatedly by doctors to turn off his life support and say goodbye.\u00a0\u00a0", "She refused.", "Last week, Tristan graduated from high school and this week celebrated this major milestone with his friends at Schoolies.", "For his mum Carolyn Elder, the Victory College graduation ceremony in Gympie had added significance.", "\"Not only was it a graduation, but there was a tribute paid to his journey and his fighting spirit, and so, yeah, it brings tears to my eyes just talking about it,\" she said.", "
Defying expectations
", "In July 2017, then 13-year-old Tristan was riding his bike when he turned into his street behind a caravan, but he didn't see an oncoming four-wheel-drive.", "Doctors treating his brain injuries in Brisbane told his mother Tristan would spend the rest of his life in a vegetative state.", "\"We were asked to turn his life support off from day 14 right through to when he breathed on his own, which was day 30,\"\u00a0Mrs Elder said.", "But she ignored their advice and watched her son slowly recover, leaving hospital after six months and returning to school the following year.\u00a0", "", "
18 year-old Tristan Sik has been able to enjoy parts of schoolies on the Sunshine Coast, handing out merchandise from his clothing company.(Supplied: Carolyn Elder)
", "
Passed with 'flying colours'
", "Mrs Elder said her son had worked up to walking with the help of a frame and his speech was improving, but she'd been most shocked by his academic progress.", "\"There was no way, even in 2017, that I thought he was going back to school,\" Mrs Elder said.", "\"But then, I shouldn't be shocked because it's Tristan.\"", "Victory College Principal Brett Costin said Tristan had passed many milestones in the past three years.", "\"When he first came back, he was struggling, especially in maths he was low, but he was able to push through and work with his support workers,\" Mr Costin said.", "", "
Victory High School Principal Brett Costin presents Tristan with the inaugural \"Tristan Lionheart Courage Award\", named after him.(Supplied: Carolyn Elder)
", "
Emotional graduation
", "It wasn't just Tristan's family who were emotional at Tristan's graduation \u2013 the teaching staff were also overcome.", "\"In 2017, we were wondering whether life support was going to be turned off and were preparing for the worst,\" Mr Costin explained.", "He said the teenager's recovery had inspired his peers.", "\"It's one of the few classes where I've ever seen where there's no cliques in the class, they're just all united and caring for each other and I think that's part of the fact that they've watched Tristan push through,\" Mr Costin said.", "Tristan himself is improving his speech and joked to his teachers that he \"carked it and then woke up\".", "He now has his own clothing company, SikLadz, and he urged his classmates to adopt its motto: \"Make your Dayz Count\".", "Tristan said he was excited for the future and planning to focus on improving his ideas and clothing designs next year.", "\"I thank my mum, dave my stepdad and Hayley (a teachers aid, who worked with Tristan for 3 years) for all their help and commitment,\" he said in a written statement to the ABC.", "For the past week, he's been mixing it up with his schoolie friends in Bundaberg, Cooroy and Mooloolaba, while taking advantage of the opportunity to hand out his merchandise to other teenagers.", "Mrs Elder said it was fantastic that her son didn't miss out on this rite of passage because of his disability.", "\"It brings a smile to his face, it gets him enjoying life and doing everything that a child of 18 years should be doing,\" she said."]
